ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.CONTACT_POINT: All communication through https://www.yortender.co.uk/ using reference:AANH-ND5UK5

TITLE.P: Housing related support services enabling independent living for people in North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Housing related support services enabling independent living for people in North East Lincolnshire. North East Lincolnshire Council has lotted its requirements into 9 specific lots:
1. Support for people with offender history;
2. Support for people with multiple complex needs for example with a propensity to exhibit chaotic behaviour;
3. Support for general multiple needs;
4. Support for people experiencing domestic abuse;
5. Support for young people accommodation based;
6. Support for young people floating support;
7. Support for single people and families;
8. Support for older people;
9. Support for people with mental health needs.

Housing related support is an approach that helps to prevent homelessness and provides people with the tools and skills to move to and maintain independent living in their community within the borough of North East Lincolnshire, reducing reliance on statutory services such as costly health and social care interventions.

TITLE.P: 1 Support for people with offender history accommodation based and floating support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 1 — Accommodation based and floating support for people with offender history:
Support services based in a residential-type and not in dormitory-type environment, for people with offender history.

This service must deliver immediate wrap-around support and liaison with probation-related services and will ultimately lead to a less intense floating support. Clients in this group may include those where offending history prohibits successful independent living or move on.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for people with multiple, severe and complex needs, accommodation based support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 2 — Accommodation based support for people with multiple, severe and complex needs:

High level support services based in accommodation suitable for individuals (i.e. single people) with a propensity to exhibit chaotic behaviour which can come with risks, for example the risk of arson. Clients are likely to have been evicted from other providers' provision due to poor behaviour which may be a barrier to successful independent living.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for people with general multiple needs, accommodation based support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 3 — Accommodation based support for people with general multiple needs:

Medium level support services based in accommodation suitable for individuals with general multiple needs, i.e. support services based in a residential-type and not in dormitory-type environment, for single people and offering a range of interventions aimed at improving independence and well being.
The client group will be predominantly aged 25 or over, however, the council reserves the right to place clients of any age in this service should service demand require it.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for people experiencing domestic abuse, accommodation based support and floating support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 4 — Accommodation based support and floating support for people experiencing domestic abuse:

The definition of domestic abuse is the abuse of 1 partner within an intimate or family relationship. It is the repeated, random and habitual use of intimidation to control a partner. The abuse can be physical, emotional, psychological, financial or sexual. Anyone forced to alter their behaviour because they are frightened of their partner's reaction is being abused.
Accommodation based support for women and children experiencing domestic abuse and floating support for all people and families experiencing domestic abuse.

Accommodation based support for men experiencing domestic abuse will be supported outside of this solution by the council. Floating support for men experiencing domestic abuse is included within this lot.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for young people, accommodation based support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 5 — Accommodation based support for young people:

Accommodation based support for young vulnerable clients. To support young people to acquire practical, daily life knowledge and skills to live independently and access mainstream services where education and training must be encouraged and enabled.

Clients will be under 25 years of age but the council reserves the right to place clients of any age in this service should service demand require it. Where a young person has parental responsibility, the child or children must equally be accommodated to meet the young person's needs.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for young people, floating support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 6 — Floating support for young people:
Clients will be vulnerable with complex needs. Education and training must be encouraged and enabled. Support is to focus primarily on life skills, raising aspirations and self-confidence.
Clients will be under 25 years of age but the council reserves the right to place clients of any age in this service, should service demand require it.

A proportion of this client group may consist of young people recently having left a care environment. These clients may have been ‘looked after children’. Where a young person has parental responsibility, the needs of the young person as a parent and the needs of the child or children must equally be supported.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for Single People and Families, floating support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 7 — Floating support for Single People and Families:

Clients will be vulnerable and have complex needs. Clients may have families to support as well as themselves. Support is to focus predominantly on life skills, raising aspirations and developing self-confidence.
The client group will be predominantly aged over 25 years, however, the council reserves the right to place clients of any age in this service should service demand require it.
Other services, such as parenting skills, must be pro-actively sign-posted using robust referrals.

Floating support may be delivered in shared housing which the provider may provide as a stepping stone from accommodation based support to floating support or delivered in the client's own accommodation.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for older people, floating support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 8 — Floating Support for Older People:

For older people the importance of maintaining their independence, living in their own home and feeling valued is of significance to them. This lot is established for people over 65 years of age, and is subject to review following changes in NICE guidance or legislation. However, the council reserves the right to place clients considered comparable.

What is required is greater promotion of prevention and early intervention activities for people aged over 65. We are trying to shift away from a dependency culture to promoting independence and self-help.
Clients are likely to be vulnerable and have complex needs. Clients are to be supported to maintain independent living and to promote socialisation to reduce loneliness and isolation.
The client group will be predominantly aged 65 or over, however, the council reserves the right to place clients of any age in this service should service demand require it.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

TITLE.P: Support for People with Mental Health Needs, floating support

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the boundaries of North East Lincolnshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 8 — Floating Support for Older People:

For older people the importance of maintaining their independence, living in their own home and feeling valued is of significance to them. This lot is established for people over 65 years of age, and is subject to review following changes in NICE guidance or legislation. However, the council reserves the right to place clients considered comparable.

What is required is greater promotion of prevention and early intervention activities for people aged over 65. We are trying to shift away from a dependency culture to promoting independence and self-help.
Clients are likely to be vulnerable and have complex needs. Clients are to be supported to maintain independent living and to promote socialisation to reduce loneliness and isolation.
The client group will be predominantly aged 65 or over, however, the council reserves the right to place clients of any age in this service should service demand require it.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract commences on 1.7.2016 and shall be effective initially for a period of 2 years. There is a further possibility of 3, 1 year extension periods depending on performance, ongoing need, budget availability and sustained terms.
The values stated are for the initial 2 year term.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: Awarded on the basis of MEAT criteria as set out in the contract notice and the tender documentation.
